personalInfo.name: Jay Gandhi
personalInfo.headline: Building Impactful Solutions, One Commit at a Time.
personalInfo.tagline: Fusing robust, production-ready Java & Python engineering with cutting-edge Generative AI, ML and NLP
personalInfo.aboutMe: My journey in software engineering has been driven by a relentless curiosity in how intelligent systems can solve complex, real-world problems. As a Research Engineer at TCS Research, I thrive at the intersection of theory and application, passionate about designing scalable systems and translating novel Machine Learning and NLP models into deployable products. My core focus includes Java, Python, Generative AI, and Microservices architecture. My commitment is to continuous learning and delivering high-quality, impactful software.

workProjects.name: Automated AI Powered Monolith to Microservices Decomposition Tool
workProjects.description: Led the design and development of an intelligent microservices decomposition system that automatically analyzes monolithic codebases using LLM-powered semantic comprehension and GNN-based clustering algorithms optimized for modularity. Successfully processed legacy systems exceeding 5 million lines of code to identify optimal service boundaries and domain alignments, achieving an 80% reduction in manual application analysis time and 70% decrease in domain mapping and service boundary identification effort. Contributed to full-stack delivery including React-based frontend integration.
workProjects.myRole: Research Engineer and Full Stack Developer

personalProjects.name: Cluster Manipulation Tool
personalProjects.description: Interactive cluster visualization and manipulation tool built with Streamlit to learn the framework. Features drag-and-drop operations, real-time search, undo/redo system (up to 10 operations), and seamless JSON import/export for team and data management. Includes merge, split, and move operations for clusters with flow-based visualization.

experience.achievement: Led a project initiavtive to design and develope an automated monolith to microservices decomposition system from scratch, reducing manual architecture refactoring efforts by 80% and resulting in 2 research papers published at well-established venues and 1 filed patent. (Refer to 'Projects' section for more details)
